meanings.definition: A spherical object used in sports and games.
meanings.sent1: I kicked the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: The children played with the ball at the park.
meanings.sent3: The ball bounced off the wall and hit me on the head.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room like a ball of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The ball spun through the air, leaving a trail of excitement.

meanings.definition: A formal social gathering for dancing.
meanings.sent1: We attended the ball at the palace.
meanings.sent2: The ballroom was beautifully decorated for the event.
meanings.sent3: The ball was a magical night of music and dance.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed like a ball of silk on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The ball was a whirlwind of elegance and grace.

meanings.definition: To form into a ball shape.
meanings.sent1: She tried to ball up the socks before putting them away.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to ball itself up when sleeping.
meanings.sent3: He balled the paper into a tight wad and threw it in the bin.
meanings.sent4: The snowball balled up as it rolled down the hill.
meanings.sent5: She balled the dough to make perfect cookies.

meanings.definition: To have a good time or enjoy oneself.
meanings.sent1: We balled at the party until late in the night.
meanings.sent2: The kids balled at the amusement park all day.
meanings.sent3: She balled so much at the concert that she lost her voice.
meanings.sent4: The friends balled together on the beach, making memories.
meanings.sent5: He balled with laughter at the comedian's jokes.
